titles.title: Providing for consideration of a motion to go to conference on any Senate amendments to the bill (H.R. 4810) to provide for reconciliation pursuant to section 103(a)(1) of the concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2001.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-752, by Ms. Pryce (OH).

Resolution provides for consideration of a motion to go to conference on H.R. 4810. The motion shall be debatable for one hour, equally divided and controlled. The resolution also provides that H.Res. 550 shall be laid on the table.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 257.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 553.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/17/2000--Introduced. Makes it in order, upon receipt of a message from the Senate transmitting any Senate amendments to H.R. 4810 (concurrent budget resolution for FY 2001), to consider in the House of Representatives a motion to disagree to such Senate amendments and to request a conference thereon.
